summary: This is an FBI evidence collection log documenting the receipt of an Apple iPhone XS from Shannon Farrar, an associate at the Law Offices of Montell Figgins, on behalf of client Michael Thomas. The phone was collected as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation (case 90A-NY-3151227). The document includes a signed consent form from Thomas authorizing the search of the device.

events.title: Collection of Michael Thomas's iPhone
events.description: FBI Special Agent received an Apple iPhone XS from Shannon Farrar on behalf of Michael Thomas. Thomas had signed a consent form authorizing the search of the device.

locations: NEW YORK (Holding Office for the FBI)
keyFacts: The FBI collected an Apple iPhone XS from Shannon Farrar of the Law Offices of Montell Figgins on August 26, 2019, as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation (case 90A-NY-3151227).
The phone belonged to Michael Thomas, who signed a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General consent form (OIG-Form 233/4) authorizing the search of the device.
Shannon Farrar witnessed Thomas's consent form and provided the unlocked iPhone to the FBI, after which the agent placed it in airplane mode and issued a property receipt.
The document is an FBI evidence collection log (FD-597) indicating standard procedure for seizing digital evidence in a federal investigation.
